name: Postdoctoral Fellow
posting_summary:
The Tulane University School of Social Work is seeking a Postdoctoral Fellow with expertise on issues pertaining to children affected by HIV and AIDS to work on research activities through the Highly Vulnerable Children Research Center. The position is supported through a federally funded grant and involves methodological and applied work focused on evaluating interventions designed to enhance the care and support of HIV-affected and other orphans and vulnerable children and families in South Africa.  The Post-doctoral Fellow will participate in analyzing ongoing study data, contributing to study development for new evaluations, dissemination efforts to promote research to practice, scholarly writing and publication, technical review of intervention curricula and monitoring and evaluation efforts of implementing partners and other efforts to build local capacity for improved program practice.  The Post-doctoral Fellow will work closely with Dr. Tonya Thurman and other members of the multidisciplinary research team. The fellow will work at the New Orleans, LA US campus (the Cape Town office is an option for applicants with pre-existing South African residency).

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES TYPICALLY NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB SUCCESSFULLY: 
(Note: The following criteria will not be used in screening qualified applicants but may be considered in the final decision-selection process of candidates interviewed.)

  • Background knowledge on the literature relevant to programmatic practice for HIV affected children
  • Understand and adapt study designs and research methods for program evaluation
  • Independently analyze data and write manuscripts for publications
  • Present data orally at meetings, seminars and conferences
  • Experience with STATA, SAS, SPSS or another statistical analysis program
minimum_education: • PhD in health, social or behavioral field with research emphasis
preferred_qualifications:
• Strong writing and communication skills
  • Advanced knowledge of the use of survey methodologies and study design for evaluating interventions
  • Demonstrated experience with analysis of evaluation and/or trial data.
  • A publication history on the social issues and/or humanitarian response surrounding HIV, especially as it pertains to children or adolescents

posting_summary: Tulane's University's Education Research Alliance for New Orleans (ERA-New Orleans) seeks a post-doctoral fellow with interest in college access to conduct and publish original research related to two ongoing projects.  The position will focus primarily on a large randomized trial of financial aid for low-income students.  In addition, The Fellow will have the opportunity to carry out qualitative work regarding the New Orleans school reforms after Hurricane Katrina.  This is a grant-funded position. name: Faculty
posting_summary:
The Department of Neurology within the Tulane Clinical Neuroscience Institute at Tulane University School of Medicine is seeking a board certified vascular neurologist to serve as the Tulane Stroke Program Medical Director.

 

The Stroke Program at Tulane University Medical Center is a Joint-Commission certified Comprehensive Stroke Center. The proposed candidate will serve as the Director of this multidisciplinary program. Tulane University Medical Center is the hub of a growing Tulane Neuroscience Network, with partners in Louisiana and Mississippi.

 

The candidate’s practice will involve outpatient clinic, inpatient hospital service, telemedicine call, as well as administrative responsibilities for the Stroke Program. The successful candidate will be expected to continue to grow the clinical Stroke Program.  Additionally, he/she will serve as the director of the vascular neurology fellowship program and direct the stroke education module for the neurology residency program. The successful candidate will also be expected to expand the stroke research program for the Neuroscience Institute in collaboration with other faculty members.

 

A competitive salary, start-up package and academic rank commensurate with training and experience will be provided.

minimum_education: • Terminal degree (PhD, ScD, DrPH, etc.) in public health or related field and teaching and research experience/interest in Disaster Management and Environmental Health
preferred_qualifications: Applicants should demonstrate strong interest or experience in interdisciplinary environmental public health research and teaching in one or more of the following areas of disaster management:  planning, response, and/or recovery. In addition to individual research and teaching, the successful candidate will have opportunities to collaborate with other faculty in the Department of Global Environmental Health Sciences, other departments in the School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine, and other schools and centers within Tulane University.  Building collaborative relationships with local and state officials in disaster management is expected.

name: Academic Geriatrician
unit_name: Section of General Internal Medicine and Geriatrics
posting_summary:
Tulane University School of Medicine and the Section of General Internal Medicine (GIM) and Geriatrics is seeking a board-certified Geriatrician who is energetic, hard-working, experienced, and a mission-driven leader to build our geriatrics program and foster development of research and scholarship within the Section of GIM and Geriatrics. The School of Medicine has recently undertaken strategic planning initiatives, “Vision 2020”, and is preparing for significant growth and future expansion.

For Tulane and its’ faculty, this is an exciting and unparalleled opportunity to participate in the growth and expansion of Tulane’s medical services in New Orleans! University Medical Center (UMC) has opened a 412 bed hospital in August 2015, and the Southeast Louisiana Veterans Health Care System (SLVHC) will open its new 200 bed hospital facility in the winter of 2016. Both the UMC and SLVHCS hospitals will serve as key clinical practice sites for our faculty. Tulane boasts a top-ranked School of Public Health, an actively productive research Center of Aging, and is a major participating partner in the Louisiana Cancer Research Center, all located within immediate proximity to the downtown School of Medicine and our three affiliated hospitals. Physicians enjoy competitive salaries and benefits package. Candidates from underrepresented minorities are encouraged to apply. No J-1, O-1 or H1-B visas please. Rank will be commensurate with experience.
minimum_education: MD/DO degree from an accredited program.
preferred_qualifications:
Board Certification/Board Eligible in Geriatric Medicine.
Ability to work as part of a professional team and to collaborate effectively with individuals within the University as well as outside contractors.
Skill in the understanding of, and sensitivity to, persons of all social, cultural, economic, and educational background.
Ability to employ process and quality improvement techniques.

name: Animal Care Trainee
unit_name: Tulane National Primate Research Center Veterinary Medicine
posting_summary:
The Animal Care Trainee will be working at the Tulane National Primate Research Center located in Covington, Louisiana.

 

The Animal Care Trainee learns to perform routine duties associated with animal care in a research setting such as feeding, maintaining sanitary conditions, observation, restraint and minor cage maintenance. Operates cage washers and ensures that equipment is in proper working order. Performs related responsibilities as required. Employees in this classification may be required to work with, take specific cautions against and/or be immunized against potentially hazardous agents. Weekend work and overtime hours are a requirement of this position. Responsible for assessing and maintaining security of animals in their primary enclosure. May be designated as essential personnel during a storm/natural disaster.  If required to work during a closure, employee must provide accurate and current contact information and is responsible for maintaining communication with TNPRC. Failure to report to work when requested by supervisor or manager will result in disciplinary action as outlined by the Staff Handbook.

 

Failure to meet established performance standards in the performance of the job duties and responsibilities outlined in this job description (or as otherwise assigned); and/or failure to interact courteously and tactfully with managers, co-ÃÂÃ­workers, customers and/or vendors such that productivity or departmental morale suffers will result in managements taking the appropriate disciplinary action as outlined in the Staff Handbook.

 

Employee attendance must meet established work schedules. Faithfulness in coming to work, being on time, planning absences in advance when possible, and calling in when unavoidably detained from reporting for work is an essential requirement of the job.

 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITITIES/COMPETENCIES TYPICALLY NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB SUCCESSFULLY:

 

  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions
  • Ability to lift items weighing up to 50 lbs
  • Ability to read and write required
  • Must have the ability to work with nonhuman primates and other laboratory animal species without jeopardizing the health of said nonhuman primates and other laboratory animal species
  • The TNPRC maintains biosafety level 3 facilities and performs work on diverse infectious agents many of which can cause serious disease in humans if standard operating procedures, including use of appropriate personal protective equipment, are not followed. Depending on agent specific risk assessments individuals may be offered, or in some cases required to have vaccinations against the relevant agents
  •  If this position is assigned to work in ABSL3 containment areas there will be additional minimum requirements including some or all of the following:

    • Ability to perform job duties while wearing respiratory protection
    • Must participate in drug and alcohol program and be in compliance with TNPRC drug and alcohol policy

name: Animal Care Technician (I, II, III, IV)
unit_name: Tulane National Primate Research Center - Veterinary Medicine
posting_summary:
The Division of Veterinary Medicine houses four position levels of Animal Care Technicians.  Each level requires a combination of number of years of animal husbandry and/or laboratory animal care experience and education.  Selection for available positions will be determined by the hiring committee and Animal Care managers and based on careful review of each candidate's resume and qualifications.  Candidates will be provided with a full job description if selected for an interview.

 

Duties of the Animal Care Technician depend on the assignment of the level and include, but are not limited to:  

 

Animal care

  • Performs routine duties associated with animal care in a research setting.
  • Prepares food and feeds animals, administers medications, maintains sanitary conditions, observes animal conditions and behavior, and collects animal specimens.
  • Feeds animals and supervises the administration of special diets and medication.
  • Observes and monitors animals for signs of illness, trauma or social instability.
  • May assist in animal restraint, maintaining animal housing and minor cage maintenance.
  • Responsible for assessing and maintaining security of animals in their primary enclosure.
  • Feeds animals and supervises the administration of special diets and medication.
  • Assists veterinarians with pre- and post- operative animal care.
  • Observes and monitors animals for signs of illness, trauma or social instability.
  • Maintains daily records pertaining to animal care.

Work environment

  • May be required to work with, take specific precautions against and/or be immunized against potentially hazardous agents.
  • Weekend work and overtime hours are a requirement of this position.
  • Performs minor repairs and maintains animal housing facility.
  • May drive utility vehicles to transport animals and supplies, ensuring safe operation, daily inspection and vehicle cleanliness.
  • Maintains adequate inventory of necessary supplies and equipment.
  • May be designated as essential personnel during a storm/natural disaster. If required to work during a closure, employee must provide accurate and current contact information and is responsible for maintaining communication with TNPRC.
  • May be required to carry a cell phone and be on after hours call.
  • Monitors environmental conditions in animal housing facilities and inspects the condition of facilities and equipment for cleanliness and proper operation.
  • Complies with OSHA standards and other applicable federal and state regulations when working with hazardous chemicals, materials, animals and power equipment.
  • Ensures that the facility complies with federal regulations for care and maintenance of research animals.
  • Follows protocol in the proper containment and disposal of bio-hazardous waste and contaminants.
  • Responsible for assessing and maintaining security of animals in their primary enclosure.
  • Research
  • Observes animal behavior and conditions, collects specimens and provides technical assistance to research and veterinary personnel.
  • Serves as a resource in the management of a particular technical specialty such as mice or primates.
  • Provides technical assistance to research and clinical medical personnel in the performance of research and emergency procedures.
  • Collects blood, urine, and other required specimens from animals as requested for medical research.
  • Responsible for assessing and maintaining security of animals in their primary enclosure.
minimum_education:
The education required for each level is listed below:

 

Animal Care Technician 1

High school diploma or equivalent and one year of animal husbandry or related animal care experience

 

Animal Care Technician 2

High school diploma or equivalent and two years of animal husbandry or related animal care experience

OR

Bachelor degree in a biological science

OR

Graduation from a two year veterinary technician program

OR

One year of laboratory animal experience and certification as an AALAS Assistant Laboratory Animal Technician (ALAT)

 

Must have a valid and unrestricted (not including corrective lens needs) U.S. Drivers license and must meet the Tulane University Motor Vehicle Policy criteria to become authorized as a driver

 

Animal Care Technician 3

High school  diploma  or  equivalent  and  four  years  of  animal  husbandry  or  related  animal care  experience,  which  includes  one  year  of laboratory  animal  experience 

OR 

Bachelors degree in a biological science and one year of laboratory animal experience 

OR 

Graduation from a two-year veterinary technician program and one year of laboratory animal experience 

OR 

Three years of   laboratory   animal   experience   and   certification   as   an   AALAS   LAT   (Laboratory   Animal   Technician)

 

Must have a valid and unrestricted (not including corrective lens needs). U.S. Driver license and must meet the Tulane University Motor Vehicle Policy criteria to become authorized as a drive

 

 

Animal Care Technician 4

High school diploma or equivalent and six years of animal husbandry or related animal care experience, which includes two years of laboratory animal experience

OR

Bachelors degree in a biological science and two years of laboratory animal experience

OR

Graduation from a two year veterinary technician program and two years of laboratory animal experience

OR

Five years of laboratory animal experience and certification as an AALAS Laboratory Animal Technician Technologist (LATg)

name: Librarian, Research Impact Analyst
unit_name: Rudolph Matas Library of the Health Sciences
posting_summary:
Tulane University seeks creative applicants for the position of Research Impact Analyst. This newly created position will serve both the Matas Health Sciences Library and the Howard Tilton Memorial Library and will assist in measuring the impact of faculty research and in raising the profile of Tulane's researchers in the STEM disciplines. The Research Impact Analyst will provide analyses of bibliometric data; offer specialized support for existing and emerging applications of impact data; and assist administrators, researchers, faculty, and graduate students with grant reporting requirements, publishing services, bibliometrics for research studies, and assistance with clinical trials investigations. This position will also serve as a scholarly engagement librarian supporting the School of Medicine, the School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine, the Tulane National Primate Research Center, and other areas related to STEM research across the University.

 

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

 

Reporting to the director of the Matas Health Sciences Library and the Dean of Information and Academic Information Resources, the Research Impact Analyst position will:

Support the Tulane research community in tracking, discovering, and communicating the impact of Tulane generated research, particularly in health sciences and related disciplines. Typical activities include:

  • Working in tandem with university partners to collect and analyze research impact data using various resources and bibliometric methods to report impact of faculty and institutional publishing and research activities
  • Understanding and interpreting a wide range of publicationÃÂ and citation ÃÂbased statistics
  • Providing researchers with information on options for dissemination, publication, and preservation of scholarly works
  • Providing training and guidance for individual researchers and groups on compliance with public access mandates for published works
  • Generating publication reports for departments and individual researchers, faculty, graduate students
  • Investigating and providing specialized support for analysis, use, and emerging applications of impact data
  • Maintaining awareness of trends related to publishing and research impact
  • Assisting with reviews of grant applications, clinical trials applications
  • Cultivate partnerships with members of the Tulane community as a scholarly engagement librarian. Typical activities include:
    • Outreach to faculty, staff, students in the research enterprises and communities
    • Providing customized consultations, services, and support for their special projects
    • Consulting on metrics and data sources for tracking of individuals or group projects
    • Providing instruction, subject guides, workshops
    • Assisting with development, evaluation and promotion of the library collections
    • Maintain professional development and responsibilities. Typical activities include:
    • Seeking out professional growth and continuing education opportunities.
    • Maintaining awareness of emerging areas in library and information profession
    • Remaining current on matters relating to research impact metrics and maintain awareness of trends in publishing and grant developments
minimum_education:
• A master's degree in science (health sciences preferred) with demonstrated experience in research analysis. MLS/MLIS degree from an ALA ÃÂaccredited graduate program or its equivalent with a strong science and informatics background is equally acceptable
  • Experiences with research impact metrics, bibliometrics and relevant related resources, e.g. ORCID, VIVObased profiles, NCBI My Bibliography
  • Familiarity with documentation methods and designing, implementing and maintaining complex services
  • Experience providing research assistance, conducting online searches across multiple resources/platforms using advanced searching techniques
  • Strong interpersonal skills in relationship building, outreach, cooperation building, and collaboration across diverse populations and groups
  • Commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and engagement with diverse communities
preferred_qualifications:

  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience of bibliographic and citation databases
  • Demonstrated experience with research impact metrics documentation, analysis, and software
  • Demonstrated experience providing services related to research impact, altmetrics, bibliometrics via training, instruction, or consultation
  • Demonstrated experience in library services, providing instruction and training of others in the use of research tools, project management software, or support for collaborative working spaces
  • Demonstrated experience in providing, developing, or assessing a new library service in higher education/academic environments

name: Director of Insurance
posting_summary:
The Director of Insurance manages the University's insurance portfolio involving both commercial insurance and self-insured risk exposures and is responsible for understanding the university's risk exposures, designing the overall insurance program and negotiating insurance pricing and terms to protect the University against various property, liability, and financial risks via risk transfer and risk financing operations. This position is also responsible for reviewing contractual agreements to advise and recommend insurance provisions to protect the University's assets and limit the exposure to loss. In addition, the Director of Insurance assists the departmental staff with university loss control measures, contract review, coverage review for claims administration and other duties, including but not limited to, review of operational budgets for insurance related expenses, serving on various university committees and representing the department during emergencies.

 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES TYPICALLY NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB SUCCESSFULLY:

  • Excellent written communication skills and proficient with word processing, spreadsheets and database programs
  • Strong verbal communication skills for presenting complex insurance principles in laymen terms to senior administrators
  • Executive presence and strong interpersonal skills and experience interfacing with a wide variety of key stakeholders; a strong collaborator and team oriented
  • Excellent analytical skills and strong financial acumen with the ability to interpret complex insurance programs
  • Strong attention to details
  • Self starter, quick study and ability to perform position duties with minimal oversight
  • Ability to manage stressful deadlines
  • Ability to exercise sound judgment and discretion at all times and maintains cooperative working relationships with both internal and external constituencies and co-workers
minimum_education:
• Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Risk Management, Insurance or related field
  • Minimum of five years of experience in commercial insurance with in-depth knowledge and technical expertise of complex insurance programs within the property and casualty areas of coverage
preferred_qualifications:
• Five years of additional experience in the field of risk management operations, identifying and assessing risks in a highly complex and decentralized organization
  • Insurance experience in higher education as an insurance/risk manager, broker, underwriter with in-depth knowledge of higher education risks
  • Advanced degree
  • Property and Casualty Insurance Agent License
  • Insurance industry professional designations (i.e. CIC, CPCU, ARM)
  • Supervisory experience

name: Postdoctoral Fellow
posting_summary:
The Post-doctoral fellow will be a graduate in microbiology or immunology and preferably have published experience in performing experiments with Mycobacterium tuberculosis or another intracellular pathogen. The fellow will be responsible for performing experiments in the level 2 and level 3 laboratories. Alternatively, published experience in immunology, especially flow cytometric techniques, would be acceptable. The employee will be trained in Biosafety protocols by the Principal Investigator as well as by the Institutional Department of Biosafety. The fellow will design and perform experiments as outlined in funded grant applications and analyze data obtained from these. The fellow will also collaborate with the PI in the dissemination of this data in the form of abstracts, meeting presentations and peer-reviewed publications. The fellow will perform experiments involving host-mycobacterium interactions using in-vitro, murine and nonhuman primate models of TB. Specific and evidenced experience with microscopy, immunohistochemistry, RNAseq and flow cytometry is desired.

 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITITIES/COMPETENCIES TYPICALLY NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB SUCCESSFULLY:

  • At least two first author publications derived from doctoral work
preferred_qualifications:

  • Experience with flow cytometry, including panel design, staining, sorting and analyses
  • Experience with live and fixed microscopy, confocal, immunohistochemistry, FISH etc.

name: Postdoctoral Fellow
posting_summary:
The Forensic Psychology Postdoctoral Fellowship at Eastern Louisiana Mental Health System is offered through the Forensic Neuropsychiatry division of the Tulane Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences. Fellows will be responsible for conducting forensic evaluations at Eastern Louisiana Mental Health System (ELMHS) and the New Orleans Forensic Aftercare Clinic (FAC). Fellows will be responsible for performing a wide variety of forensic mental health assessments as part of an interdisciplinary treatment team. A wide range of evaluations are requested at the state hospital and include: competency to stand trial (CST) evaluations, evaluations for malingering, psychodiagnostic clarification, intellectual and cognitive evaluations, and risk evaluations. Evaluees are justice-involved individuals who have been adjudicated not guilty by reason of insanity (NGRI) or deemed incompetent to stand trial by the court. Fellows will be responsible for selecting, administering, scoring, and interpreting psychological tests with the goal of writing high-quality integrated forensic reports. Additionally, fellows will have the opportunity to participate in administrative and clinical meetings, conduct research, and supervise other trainees under the umbrella supervision of a licensed psychologist. Fellows will attend forensic training seminars and scheduled didactics, including landmark case seminar and expert witness seminar. Participation in the annual mock trial conducted jointly with the Tulane Law Clinic and the Tulane Forensic Psychiatry Fellowship is anticipated.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES TYPICALLY NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB SUCCESSFULLY:
1. Ability to use and interpret forensic psychological assessment instruments and the ability to obtain relevant data through third-party data gathering and a comprehensive forensic interview
2. Ability to integrate results and formulate interpretations consistent with data, relevant for the conclusions related to the legal question
3. Ability to write a high caliber forensic report that demonstrates excellent writing skills, including the ability to write an accurate, comprehensive, and defensible integrated forensic report focused on the referral/psycholegal issue
4. Ability to execute good time management, demonstrating organizational and self- management skills
5. Ability to communicate and work in high stress situations
6. Ability to demonstrate a working knowledge of, and practice consistent with, the Specialty Guidelines for Forensic Psychologists and the APAÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂs Ethical Principles and Code of Conduct for Psychologists
minimum_education:
• Successful completion of PhD in Clinical Psychology with a concentration in forensic psychology at an APA-accredited program by start of the fellowship
  • Eligibility for state or provincial licensure or certification for the independent practice of psychology by start of the fellowship
preferred_qualifications:
• Interest in and ability to provide expert testimony in a clear, articulate manner, consistent with ethical and practice guidelines
  • Eligibility for board certification in Forensic Psychology by the American Board of Professional Psychology (ABPP) at the conclusion of the fellowship
  • Interest in conducting forensic research

name: Associate Dean of Academics
posting_summary:
The Tulane University School of Social Work invites applications for a 12-month tenured faculty appointment for the position of Associate Dean of Academic Affairs. The Associate Dean has responsibility for fostering innovative and collaborative, methods for the development, implementation, and monitoring of the academic programs in the TSSW.

Specifically, the Associate Dean provides strategic academic leadership and oversight of Master of Social Work (on-ground and online), Master of Science in Disaster Resiliency Leadership (DRLA), and Doctorate of Social Work (DSW) programs, pedagogy, curricula, and instruction to ensure successful delivery of the academic programs. Candidates shall have a strong record of research, teaching, and service consistent with an appointment at the rank of Associate or Full Professor with tenure. The TSSW is seeking candidates with expertise in any of the following areas: Behavioral health, addiction, clinical practice, community organizing, health disparities, or disaster mental health. 

The Associate Dean serves as a consultant to the Dean on academic matters, and supports full, part-time, and adjunct faculty.  The Associate Dean is the lead in ensuring high-quality instruction in TSSW courses and programs, and on all accreditation matters and processes. The Associate Dean is also responsible for working collaboratively with the Assistant Dean of Administration and Finance, faculty, and staff, to implement administrative policies and procedures.  The Associate Dean will work collaboratively with the Dean and directly with faculty on the development of a strategic vision and implementation strategy for TSSW.

The Associate Dean Administrative appointment will be reviewed every three years and will have the opportunity to be renewed; pending continued successful reviews associated with both administrative and academic excellence.
preferred_qualifications:
Earned doctorate or other terminal degree in a field of study relevant to Social Work, Psychology, or Public Health.

At least three years of directly related experience with faculty development, academic support, curriculum oversight, and program development.

name: Assistant Professor
posting_summary:
Plant Molecular Ecologist

The Department of Ecology & Evolutionary Biology at Tulane University invites applications for a tenure-track faculty position at the Assistant Professor level with a research focus on the application of molecular techniques (e.g., population genetics, molecular genomics) to address ecological and/or evolutionary questions in plants. Preference will be given to researchers whose work complements one or both of our departmental concentrations in tropical biology and river/coast ecosystems. We are also interested in candidates whose research can be applied to restoration and conservation issues.

The position is 60% research, 10% service and 30% teaching, with lab space and a competitive start up package to be provided. The faculty member will be responsible for teaching one course per semester and will rotate among 3 or 4 different courses. In addition to teaching, faculty members mentor Ph.D., M.S. and B.S. students in Tulane’s School of Science and Engineering. 

The vision of the Department of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology is to be recognized as a center for solution-based science in ecology and evolutionary biology with foci in tropical and river-coast ecosystems. We aim to conduct translational research: basic scientific advance is not only an end in itself but also a means to providing solutions to global environmental challenges. The department maintains interactions with nationally and internationally recognized programs. For example, Tulane is a member of the Organization for Tropical Studies and our students and faculty interact with study abroad courses worldwide. Locally, our department is involved in the Riversphere – A Center of Excellence in Renewable Energy Systems, and The ByWater Institute. Along with a shared molecular facility within our department, we collaborate with the School of Science and Engineering to use the Coordinated Instrumentation Facility.

 

The department participates actively in multiple community-engaged Tulane University activities, including the Center for Engaged Teaching and Learning, Girls in STEM at Tulane (GIST), Boys at Tulane in STEM (BATS), the Taylor Center for Social Innovation and Design Thinking, and Tulane’s mandatory two-tiered service learning requirement for undergraduates (CPS). We are fully committed and proactive in seeking ways to achieve the goal of a diverse and inclusive academic community of faculty, staff and students and we seek individuals who will actively support this goal.

Tulane University is a member of the prestigious Association of American Universities, a select group of the 62 leading research universities in the United States and Canada with 'preeminent programs of graduate and professional education and scholarly research.' Tulane is located in the historic Gulf Coast city of New Orleans, which is known for its culture, food and music.
minimum_education: The successful candidate must have a Ph.D. degree in Biology, Ecology, Evolutionary Biology, or a related field. Postdoctoral research experience is strongly preferred.

name: Director and Chief Academic Officer
posting_summary:
"Do NOT use the Apply Now icon on this page to apply for this position." 

Please be aware that all applicants must apply for this position electronically via the following link:  https://apply.interfolio.com/42521

NOTE:  Materials submitted through this Tulane Jobs portal will not be considered.

 

Tulane University, one of the nation’s most prestigious research institutions, seeks a visionary, experienced and ambitious leader as the Director and Chief Academic Officer of the Tulane National Primate Research Center (TNPRC). Established in 1964, TNPRC is a national scientific resource and one of seven NIH-supported National Primate Research Centers. The Director and Chief Academic Officer will build on the long record of outstanding research accomplishment, the strong base of national and international collaboration, and the commitment to excellence in research, education and service at TNPRC.

TNPRC is an exciting, vibrant and productive unit valued highly at Tulane and around the country. The Center functions as a fully integrated part of the University, engaged with leadership and faculty in the Schools of Medicine, Public Health and Tropical Medicine, and Science and Engineering to achieve their common goals for research and education in the health sciences. With strong support from the University, TNPRC is actively growing; indeed, a total of $34,109,500 has been expended on construction and renovation projects since 2011 with plans underway for continuing progress. Academic and research programs continue to grow at the Center through activities of core scientists, colleagues around the University, and active collaborations with partners around the country.

The TNPRC Director and Chief Academic Officer (the Director) is responsible for ensuring the vitality and long-term success of the Center while engaging with the broader University community to advance Tulane’s mission and elevate its national stature. The Director will provide leadership and oversight for the management of TNPRC’s research and scientific direction and for TNPRC administration. Responsibilities include leadership of the research and teaching missions, fiscal oversight, responsibility for scientific program functions including research and service divisions, core laboratories, nonhuman primate resources, and Center operations. The Director will be responsible for the recruitment and professional development of faculty appointed at TNPRC. He/She will support and expand TNPRC’s academic programs and the strong sponsored research portfolio. He/She will nurture close relationships with academic and administrative units of the University; leverage administrative, fiscal, and operational best practices; and expand productive partnerships with other academic and research institutions, including other National Primate Research Centers.
minimum_education: • A doctoral degree in a health science discipline
preferred_qualifications:
• An intellectual leader with academic stature; a distinguished scholar with experience in nonhuman primate research
  • Leadership experience in a program of basic and/or applied biomedical research from an academic entity of comparable complexity. Demonstrated experience in increasing the research impact and national visibility of the entity
  • A highly collaborative individual with strong interpersonal skills to work effectively across the University’s schools and units and with University leadership to advance our common mission

name: Assistant Professor
posting_summary:
Assistant Professor in Experimental Physics at Tulane


Tulane University invites applications for a tenure track Assistant Professor position in experimental physics in the Department of Physics and Engineering Physics. Preference will be given to applicants who have an outstanding research record in experimental physics and whose research complements existing research areas in the department (energy materials, biological materials, quantum materials and devices, low temperature condensed matter physics, photonic materials and devices, polymer physics, computational materials, quantum information and quantum computing, quantum chaos, nonlinear optics, optical spectroscopy, nanofabrication/nanotechnology, and nuclear physics). We are also committed to interdisciplinary research and teaching with other faculty in our School of Science and Engineering, as well as the School of Medicine and the other Schools at Tulane. The new faculty member will have the opportunity to participate in the ongoing expansion of the materials science and engineering effort at Tulane, including a recently launched Ph.D. program in Materials Physics and Engineering.


Applicants must possess a doctorate in physics or a closely related field, postdoctoral or comparable experience, demonstrated excellence in research, and a commitment to teaching. The position will include a competitive salary and startup package. Applicants should submit a cover letter, CV, a research plan, and contact information for three references.  Applications submitted on or before November 10, 2018 will receive full consideration. Further information about the department can be found at tulane.edu/sse/pep. Inquiries can be directed to Dr. Lev Kaplan at lkaplan@tulane.edu .

name: Clinical Instructor Grant Project Attorney
posting_summary: The Tulane Law School Domestic Violence Clinic focuses on gender-based violence and its far-reaching effects on families and communities.  Clinic faculty introduce students to the complex legal problems survivors of abuse face, teach lawyering and trial-practice skills, and provide holistic, free legal services to survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, and stalking.  Throughout the academic year, faculty guide students to explore intersections between domestic violence and other social problems, such as housing insecurity, incarceration, child abuse, and gender inequity.  The Clinic's work also includes advocacy for civil and criminal justice system reform in the legal responses to abuse, and a Women's Prison Project that addresses connections between abuse and female incarceration.

Necessary experiments include those involving molecular biology, immunology and microbiology, in adherence with the Standard Operating Protocols (SOPs) in place.  The Lab Supervisor II will also conducts research analysis and prepare scientific reports; as well as assist in supervising assigned laboratory personnel.

posting_summary:
The Director of Internal Audit will direct and administer the internal audit function for the University and make periodic reports to the Audit Committee of the Board. The Director of Internal Audit reports to the Senior Vice President and COO and also reports directly to the Chairman of the Audit Committee, as needed. The Director will work closely with the University's Risk Manager with regard to many aspects of the internal audit function and the Enterprise-wide Risk Management assessment.

The Director will be responsible for the following duties:

Coordinate activities and audit services with contract internal auditors, as needed. Develop annual/multi-year internal audit plan with senior management.

- Prepare for and attend the Audit Committee meetings to discuss audit plans and review significant audit findings. state and federal laws, as applicable.

- Serve as primary interface between faculty and staff and the internal audit function.

- Assist external auditors in the annual examination of the University's financial statements.

- Develop and control operating budget for the internal audit function and recommend budget requests for each fiscal year. 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and written.

posting_summary:

This role may be primarily placed in collaborating community-based organizations, work in the field to recruit, enroll, and assess participants at 4-month intervals for the duration of the study.

 

Primary job functions include: (1) traveling to assigned project sites to identify and engage potential study participants; (2) recruitment, retention, and implementation of assessments using prepared questions; (3) data entry in real-time using mobile phone and web-based systems; (4) participant tracking and follow-up at pre-determined time points; and, (5) provide enrollment updates to RERC Director, Assessment Coordinator, and supervisor on an ongoing basis. The incumbent must have: skill in developing rapport with individuals, including young people from diverse ethnic and cultural backgrounds; excellent organizational skills to assist the assessment team to meet goals within specified time period. Phlebotomy skills and bilingual Spanish/English language skills are preferred, but not required. Must have reliable transportation.

The TNPRC maintains Biosafety Level 3 facilities and performs worn on diverse infections agents many of with can cause serious disease in humans if standard operating procedures, including use of appropriate personal protective equipment, are not followed.  Depending on agent specific risk assessments, individuals may be offered, or in some cases required to have, vaccinations against the relevant agents.

name: Professor of Practice
posting_summary:
TULANE UNIVERSITY, DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHOLOGY in the School of Science and Engineering, announces an opening for a PROFESSOR OF PRACTICE in SCHOOL PSYCHOLOGY starting in July 2018. The Professor of Practice is a renewable three-year regular faculty position that is devoted to teaching and does not lead to tenure.

Specific responsibilities of the 9-month appointment include teaching three courses per semester, including graduate courses, practicum supervision, and an undergraduate course in Abnormal Psychology. Potential graduate courses and associated practicum supervision include Psychological Assessment I (cognitive) or II (emotional/behavioral), Behavioral and Cognitive-Behavioral Intervention, and Cognitive-Behavior Therapy. Active participation in program development and training initiatives is also expected.

 

The School Psychology Program is housed within the Department of Psychology, which consists of 21 full-time faculty, 7 of whom serve as core faculty in the School Psychology Program. The Program offers the Ph.D. degree and is accredited by the American Psychological Association. The Program is guided by an ecologically-grounded scientist-practitioner model of training, with particular emphasis on the contexts of development and culture. Practicum training takes place in a range of settings, including public schools, a campus-based clinic, and community health and mental health settings.

 

We are dedicated to maintaining a culturally diverse faculty, and we strongly encourage applications from women and members of under-represented groups.

Inquiries regarding the position may be directed to Dr. Stacy Overstreet, Chair, Search Committee (soverst@tulane.edu).
minimum_education: Minimum qualifications include a Ph.D. in School Psychology from an APA accredited program; eligibility for licensure and certification in Louisiana; and evidence of teaching experience. Individuals with a Ph.D. in Child Clinical Psychology may also apply if there is evidence of significant school-based training and experience.

posting_summary:
Under the direct supervision of the Program Manager the Field Research Assistant provides assistance with screening, recruiting and enrolling research participants, as well as assists with retention efforts for the Recruitment, Engagement, and Retention Center (RERC) for the Adolescent Trials Network (ATN) cooperative agreement and its linked research projects. This role will often work in the field to help recruit, enroll, and assess participants at 4-month intervals for the duration of the study.

Primary job functions include: (1) traveling to assigned project sites to help identify and engage potential study participants; (2) assist with the recruitment and retention of implemented assessments using prepared questions; (3) assist with data entry in real-time using mobile phone and web-based systems; (4) assist with participant tracking and follow-up at pre-determined time points; and, (5) help provide enrollment updates to RERC Director, Assessment Coordinator, and supervisor on an ongoing basis. The incumbent must have: skill in developing rapport with individuals, including young people from diverse ethnic and cultural backgrounds; excellent organizational skills to assist the assessment team to meet goals within specified time period.

name: Clinical Track, Assistant Professor, Stroke Neurologist
posting_summary:
The Department of Neurology within the Tulane Clinical Neuroscience Institute at Tulane University School of Medicine is seeking a board eligible/certified vascular neurologist to serve to work within the Tulane Stroke Program.

The Stroke Program at Tulane University Medical Center is a Joint-Commission certified Comprehensive Stroke Center. The proposed candidate will join this multidisciplinary team. Tulane University Medical Center is the hub of a growing Tulane Neuroscience Network, with partners in Louisiana and Mississippi.

The candidates practice will involve outpatient clinic, inpatient hospital service, telemedicine call, as well as teaching and research. The successful candidate will be expected to continue to grow the clinical Stroke Program.  He/she will teach students, residents as well as mentor the fellow enrolled in our ACGME-accredited vascular neurology fellowship program. The successful candidate will also be expected to expand the stroke research program for the Neuroscience Institute in collaboration with other faculty members.

A competitive salary, start-up package and academic rank commensurate with training and experience will be provided.

name: Clinical Research Coordinator III
unit_name: LA CaTS Clinical Research Resources Core
posting_summary:
The primary responsibility of the Clinical Research Coordinator III is to manage all aspects of conducting clinical trials, with minimal supervision. The Clinical Research Coordinator III is required to have an in-depth knowledge of protocol requirements and good clinical practices as set forth by federal regulations. As the primary resource for the protocol, the Clinical Research Coordinator III acts as a liaison between the patient, investigator, Institutional Review Board and sponsor. The Clinical Research Coordinator III screens, enrolls and follows study patients, ensuring protocol compliance and close patient monitoring, and works independently in designing, coordinating, and implementing all assigned research projects. The Clinical Research Coordinator III is responsible for all data and source documentation, adverse event reporting and maintenance of complete regulatory files.

5.       Ability to acquire and maintain credentialing at all required institutions: Tulane Medical Center, Veterans Administration Hospital/New Orleans, LA and University Medical Center.

name: Laboratory Research Technician
posting_summary:
The Laboratory Research Technician provides research support to the Principal Investigator for a dynamic laboratory with a major focus on the immunology of persistent bacterial infection and vaccination. The position is expected to plan experiments, including the design and execution of a novel transgenic mouse model, maintain lab equipment, and coordinate other lab activities, as assigned. Duties also include small animal work (including husbandry, breeding, weaning, genotyping) and techniques such as flow cytometry, microscopy, cell purification, and cell culture. The position is also responsible for maintaining experimental records and keeping logs of mouse strains, mouse colony management and general lab supply inventory, purchasing and invoicing. The Laboratory Research Technician manages laboratory financial accounts, provides initial training to all new laboratory personnel, supervises undergraduate student employees and acts as the interface between the laboratory and various institutional agencies (i.e. the animal vivarium).

 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES TYPICALLY NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB SUCCESSFULLY:

1. Strong organizational skills, including familiarity with maintaining databases and concise record keeping.

2. A good attitude and willingness to learn.

3. Confidence with new technology.

4. Work both as a team and independently within a research group involved in immunology and infectious disease.

5. Familiarity with the principles of molecular biology and immunology.

6. Solid analytical skills and attention to detail.

7. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

8. Excellent organizational skills;

9. Excellent interpersonal skills;

10. Ability to multi-task, and prioritize work assignments;

11. Ability to maintain confidentiality in all work performed;

12. Ability to independently work on research assignments.
minimum_education: Bachelors degree
preferred_qualifications:
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

1. Bachelors degree in Biological or Chemical Science.

2. Research experience with immunological methods.

3. Experience specifically in PCR, molecular cloning, protein quantification, SDS-PAGE, and Western  blot.

name: Post Doctoral Research Fellow
posting_summary: The Department of Global Environmental Health Sciences at the School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine is seeking an outstanding candidate with a PhD for a postdoctoral position with strong interest in environmental geochemistry focusing on understanding human health effects of exposure to inorganic contaminants in drinking water and other sources. The main activity of the postdoc is to conduct fieldwork and lab-based research in a federally funded study that will involve assessment of water quality and biomarker measurements of inorganic contaminants, including fluoride, metals, and their stable isotopes in water, food, and biological samples. We are seeking a candidate with strong geochemical laboratory skills in sample preparation, digestion, and chromatographic extraction of metals such as calcium and iron from biological samples for determination of their isotopes using mass spectrometry. The research will benefit from new, well-equipped, analytical laboratories, including Agilent High Precision ICPMS, and HDMS-facilitated fluoride measurement in biological and other environmental samples. Previous skill on mass spectrometry, GIS and statistical analyses are preferred but not required. The appointment will be made on a yearly basis up to three years, based on research performance.
minimum_education: • A PhD degree in the area of environmental geochemistry/biogeochemistry/water quality and biomarker applications of elemental and stable isotopes in exposure and health
preferred_qualifications:
• Laboratory sample preparation, acid-based digestion of biological (e.g., urine and nail) and environmental samples (e.g., food and soil) for trace element and stable isotope analysis
  • Chromatographic isolation of at least one or more metals (e.g., Fe/Ca/Mg or others) from complex biological (urine and blood) or environmental matrices (food sources)
  • Ability to develop analytical methods or adopt methods based on published methodologies

name: Visiting Assistant Professor
posting_summary:
Tulane University, A. B, Freeman School of Business invites applications for visiting faculty positions in Accounting, effective July 1, 2017.

Candidates should have earned or expect to complete a PhD in Accounting / related discipline by July 1, 2017. We seek candidates who have strong teaching skills and are interested in teaching in the auditing, managerial or financial accounting area. Salary and teaching requirements are commensurate with other major research institutions.

Tulane University enrolls approximately 13,500 students and is a privately funded, comprehensive research university located in New Orleans. New Orleans is a vibrant, multicultural community celebrated worldwide for its music, art, and food. name: Assistant Professor
posting_summary:
Animal Physiological Ecologist

 

The Department of Ecology & Evolutionary Biology at Tulane University invites applications for a tenure-track faculty position at the Assistant Professor level conducting physiological research addressing ecological or evolutionary questions in animals, including but not limited to, endocrine, genomic, and behavioral approaches. Preference will be give to researchers whose work complements one or both of our departmental concentrations in tropical biology and river/coast ecosystems. We are also interested in candidates whose work can be applied to restoration and conservation issues.

The position is 60% research, 10% service and 30% teaching, with lab space and a competitive start up package to be provided. The faculty member will be responsible for teaching one course per semester and will rotate between 3 or 4 different courses. In addition to teaching, faculty members mentor Ph.D., M.S. and B.S. students in Tulane’s School of Science and Engineering

The vision of the Department of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology is to be recognized as a center for solution-based science in ecology and evolutionary biology with foci in tropical and river-coast ecosystems. We aim to conduct translational research: basic scientific advance is not only an end in itself but also a means to providing solutions to global environmental challenges. The department maintains interactions with nationally and internationally recognized programs. For example, Tulane is a member of the Organization for Tropical Studies and our students and faculty interact with study abroad courses worldwide. Further, we maintain an internationally recognized collection of fishes at Tulane University Biodiversity Research Institute. Locally, our department is involved in the Riversphere – A Center of Excellence in Renewable Energy Systems, and The ByWater Institute. Along with a shared molecular facility within our department, we collaborate with the School of Science and Engineering to use the Coordinated Instrumentation Facility.

 

The department participates actively in multiple community-engaged Tulane University activities, including the Center for Engaged Teaching and Learning, Girls in STEM at Tulane (GIST), Boys at Tulane in STEM (BATS), the Taylor Center for Social Innovation and Design Thinking, and Tulane’s mandatory two-tiered service learning requirement for undergraduates (CPS). We are fully committed and proactive in seeking ways to achieve the goal of a diverse and inclusive academic community of faculty, staff and students and we seek individuals who will actively support this goal.

Tulane University is a member of the prestigious Association of American Universities, a select group of the 62 leading research universities in the United States and Canada with 'preeminent programs of graduate and professional education and scholarly research.' Tulane is located in the historic Gulf Coast city of New Orleans, which is known for its culture, food and music.
minimum_education: The successful candidate must have a Ph.D. degree in Biology, Ecology, Evolutionary Biology, or related field. Postdoctoral research experience is strongly preferred.

The A.B. Freeman School of Business at Tulane University is seeking applicants for tenure system faculty positions (Professor/Associate Professor) in accounting. These are full-time appointments in the School's accounting area. All positions are to start July 1, 2018. Salary, teaching load, and research support are commensurate with other major research institutions. Ultimate recruitment for this position is subject to final budgetary approval by the University.

Candidates are expected to hold a Ph. D. in accounting or a related discipline by July 1, 2018. Candidates for Professor and Associate Professor must qualify for tenure at the Freeman School. We seek candidates with strong research and teaching skills.

name: Professor of Practice
posting_summary:
The A.B. Freeman School of Business at Tulane University is seeking applicants for non-tenure system faculty positions (Professor of Practice) in accounting. These are full-time appointments in the School's accounting area. All positions are to start July 1, 2018. Salary, teaching load, and benefits are commensurate with other major research institutions. Ultimate recruitment for these positions is subject to final budgetary approval by the University.

Candidates are expected to hold a Ph. D. in accounting or a related discipline or have a graduate degree in a business discipline and extensive experience in the practice of accounting. We seek candidates with strong teaching skills and the ability to make intellectual contributions to the profession.

name: Research Nurse I
posting_summary:
This is an entry-level part-time nursing position.  Training will be provided to develop the necessary skills required of a research nurse.  The primary responsibility of the Research Nurse I is to manage RN responsibilities in the conduct of clinical trials.  The Research Nurse I is required to have an in-depth knowledge of protocol requirements and good clinical practices as set forth by federal regulations.  As one of the primary RN resources for the CTU protocols, the Research Nurse I acts as a liaison between the patient, investigator, Institutional Review Board and sponsor in carrying out the RN responsibilities of the protocol.  The Research Nurse I assists with screening, enrolling and following study patients, ensuring protocol compliance and close patient monitoring, all as part of the required learning process required in this primary position for advancement toward a Research Nurse II and III position.  The Research Nurse I provides direct patient care for clinical trials subjects.  The Research Nurse I assists with data and source documentation, adverse event reporting and maintenance of complete regulatory files, also as a part of the learning experience.

 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES TYPICALLY NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB SUCCESSFULLY: 

  • In-depth knowledge of Louisiana RN Scope of Practice regulations
  • In-depth knowledge of routine registered nurse procedures and familiarity with blood draws and infusions
  • Ability to acquire and maintain all required CITI training certificates
  • Ability to acquire and maintain credentialing at all required institutions: Tulane Medical Center, Veterans Administration Hospital/New Orleans, LA and University Medical Center
minimum_education:
• RN with current licensure required. Must be licensed through the State of Louisiana by date of hire       
  • Bachelor degree required
preferred_qualifications:
• Computer/data entry experience desired
  • Bachelor's of Science in Nursing strongly desired

name: Painter
posting_summary:
The painter will perform industrial/commercial type painting, refinishing, and spraying to structures, furnishings, surfaces, and equipment.  Hang and finish drywall and wall paper and finish casework.  Responsible with cleaning and maintaining work areas. 

This is an Essential Personnel position which can require that the incumbent must report for duty and work through emergencies, and also can be designated by the supervisor as essential for the accomplishment of work, or for the completion of a critical task.

  • Ability and willingness to work nights, weekends, and possibly holidays

name: Assistant Professor
posting_summary:
Trauma/Critical Care/Acute Care Surgery position in New Orleans, LA

 

Tulane University School of Medicine's Department of Surgery is seeking candidates for a clinical faculty position in Trauma/Critical Care/Acute Care Surgery at the assistant or associate professor level.

 

This is an excellent opportunity for a trauma/critical care surgeon interested in developing a growing trauma program and incorporating the academic aspects of a busy and diverse surgical service. Interest and experience in education and resident training is essential.

 

Applicants will be accepted until qualified candidates are identified.
minimum_education: Candidates should have satisfactorily completed a training program in general surgery accredited by the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education (ACGME) and be board certified, or eligible if recently trained, and eligible for licensure in Louisiana. Fellowship training in trauma and critical care is required.

name: Assistant/Associate Professor
posting_summary:
Position Description

Academic Gastroenterologist with expertise in GI Motility for full time position of Assistant/Associate Professor/ Professor at the Tulane University School of Medicine. The position includes staff appointment at the Tulane Medical Center, University Medical center in New Orleans and South East Louisiana Veterans Health Care System. Clinic responsibilities include inpatient consults; Outpatient clinics and endoscopic procedures at Tulane & may include clinical responsibilities UMC and SLVHCS. Position will also involve teaching fellows, residents and students.

name: Clinical Protocol Technician
posting_summary:
Assist in the day-to-day conduct of cardio-renal disease research studies and clinical trials. Specific responsibilities include recruiting patients, conducting chart reviews, conducting patient visits including measuring blood pressure and anthropometric measurements, conducting non-invasive cardiovascular disease test procedures (e.g. electrocardiograms), assisting study participants in the completion of study questionnaires, administering study questionnaires, assist with the coordination with pharmacy for drug dispensing and ordering, and monitoring patient safety.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES TYPICALLY NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB SUCCESSFULLY:

  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Highly organized and detail oriented
  • Ability to complete detailed assignments by assigned deadlines and to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision
  • Willing to travel occasionally to conduct patient home visits and to attend coordinating center meetings
  • Proficient with Microsoft applications
minimum_education: • High School diploma/equivalent
preferred_qualifications:
• Bachelors degree in a biological related field is strongly preferred
  • Experience working with patients in a clinical or hospital setting is strongly preferred
  • Strong familiarity with and ability to follow research clinical protocols are preferred

name: Clinical Track, Assistant Professor
unit_name: Neurosurgery, Baton Rouge General Medical Center
posting_summary:
The Department of Neurosurgery at Tulane University's Center for Clinical Neurosciences at Baton Rouge General Medical Center is seeking a Board certified or Board eligible neurosurgeon.  Candidates should have an interest in general neurosurgery, possess a strong work ethic, and be team oriented.

Physician will be a part of the Center for Clinical Neurosciences, which consists of 7 neurosurgery faculty and 15 neurology faculty. The Center is part of the Tulane Health System, which is nationally recognized for providing high-quality patient care and for research and education. Baton Rouge provides excellent school systems, two universities, museums, festivals and abundant outdoor and cultural activities. A strong primary care referral base and medical staff combination will give the new physician an opportunity to build a very successful practice.

Tulane is offering a very competitive salary, start-up package and academic rank commensurate with training and experience.

 

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

Doctorate
minimum_education:
Qualifications
Required license or certification:

Medical License

Board Certification
